extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.ConsumeBoxEnterpriseEvents
extension.description: Consumes Enterprise Events from Box admin_logs_streaming Stream Type. The content of the events is sent to the 'success' relationship as a JSON array. The last known position of the Box stream is stored in the processor state and is used to resume the stream from the last known position when the processor is restarted.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: Event Types
property.description: A comma separated list of Enterprise Events to consume. If not set, all Events are consumed.See Additional Details for more information.

property.name: Start Event Position
property.description: What position to consume the Events from.

allowableValue.description: Start consuming events from the earliest available Event.
Start consuming events from the latest Event.
Start consuming events from the specified offset.

property.name: Start Offset
property.description: The offset to start consuming the Events from.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Events received successfully will be sent out this relationship.

stateful.description: The last known position of the Box Event stream is stored in the processor state and is used to resume the stream from the last known position when the processor is restarted.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.ConsumeBoxEvents
extension.description: Consumes all events from Box. This processor can be used to capture events such as uploads, modifications, deletions, etc. The content of the events is sent to the 'success' relationship as a JSON array. Events can be dropped in case of NiFi restart or if the queue capacity is exceeded. The last known position of the Box stream is stored in the processor state and is used to resume the stream from the last known position when the processor is restarted.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: Queue Capacity
property.description: The maximum size of the internal queue used to buffer events being transferred from the underlying stream to the processor. Setting this value higher allows more messages to be buffered in memory during surges of incoming messages, but increases the total memory used by the processor during these surges.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Events received successfully will be sent out this relationship.

stateful.description: The last known position of the Box stream is stored in the processor state and is used to resume the stream from the last known position when the processor is restarted.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.CreateBoxFileMetadataInstance
extension.description: Creates a metadata instance for a Box file using a specified template with values from the flowFile content. The Box API requires newly created templates to be created with the scope set as enterprise so no scope is required. The input record should be a flat key-value object where each field name is used as the metadata key.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: File ID
property.description: The ID of the file for which to create metadata.

property.name: Template Key
property.description: The key of the metadata template to use for creation.

property.name: Record Reader
property.description: The Record Reader to use for parsing the incoming data

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if an error occurs during metadata creation.

relationship.name: file not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box file was not found will be routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after metadata has been successfully created.

relationship.name: template not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified metadata template was not found will be routed to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the file for which metadata was created

writesAttribute.name: box.template.key
writesAttribute.description: The template key used for metadata creation

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.CreateBoxMetadataTemplate
extension.description: Creates a Box metadata template using field specifications from the flowFile content. Expects a schema with fields: "'type' (required), 'key' (required), 'displayName' (optional), 'description' (optional), 'hidden' (optional, boolean).

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: Template Name
property.description: The display name of the metadata template to create.

property.name: Template Key
property.description: The key of the metadata template to create (used for API calls).

property.name: Hidden
property.description: Whether the template should be hidden in the Box UI.

property.name: Record Reader
property.description: The Record Reader to use for parsing the incoming data

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if an error occurs during template creation.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after a template has been successfully created.

writesAttribute.name: box.template.name
writesAttribute.description: The template name that was created

writesAttribute.name: box.template.key
writesAttribute.description: The template key that was created

writesAttribute.name: box.template.scope
writesAttribute.description: The template scope.

writesAttribute.name: box.template.fields.count
writesAttribute.description: Number of fields created for the template

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.DeleteBoxFileMetadataInstance
extension.description: Deletes a metadata instance from a Box file using the specified template key

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: File ID
property.description: The ID of the file from which to delete metadata.

property.name: Template Key
property.description: The key of the metadata template instance to delete.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if an error occurs during metadata deletion.

relationship.name: file not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box file was not found will be routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after metadata has been successfully deleted.

relationship.name: template not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified metadata template was not found will be routed to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the file from which metadata was deleted

writesAttribute.name: box.template.key
writesAttribute.description: The template key used for metadata deletion

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.ExtractStructuredBoxFileMetadata
extension.description: Extracts metadata from a Box file using Box AI. The extraction can use either a template or a list of fields. The extracted metadata is written to the FlowFile content as JSON.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: File ID
property.description: The ID of the file from which to extract metadata.

property.name: Extraction Method
property.description: The method to use for extracting metadata. TEMPLATE uses a Box metadata template for extraction. FIELDS uses a JSON schema of fields (read from FlowFile content) for extraction.

allowableValue.description: Uses a Box metadata template for extraction.

Uses a JSON schema of fields to extract from the FlowFile content. The schema should include 'key' (required); 'type', 'description', 'displayName', 'prompt', and 'options' fields are optional. This follows the BOX API schema for fields.

property.name: Template Key
property.description: The key of the metadata template to use for extraction. Required when Extraction Method is TEMPLATE.

property.name: Record Reader
property.description: The Record Reader to use for parsing the incoming data. Required when Extraction Method is FIELDS.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if an error occurs during metadata extraction.

relationship.name: file not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box file was not found will be routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after metadata has been successfully extracted.

relationship.name: template not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified metadata template was not found will be routed to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the file from which metadata was extracted

writesAttribute.name: box.ai.template.key
writesAttribute.description: The template key used for extraction (when using TEMPLATE extraction method)

writesAttribute.name: box.ai.extraction.method
writesAttribute.description: The extraction method used (TEMPLATE or FIELDS)

writesAttribute.name: box.ai.completion.reason
writesAttribute.description: The completion reason from the AI extraction

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: Set to 'application/json' for the JSON content

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.FetchBoxFile
extension.description: Fetches files from a Box Folder. Designed to be used in tandem with ListBoxFile.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: box-file-id
property.description: The ID of the File to fetch

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile will be routed here for each File for which fetch was attempted but failed.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile will be routed here for each successfully fetched File.

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The id of the file

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the file

writesAttribute.name: path
writesAttribute.description: The folder path where the file is located

writesAttribute.name: box.size
writesAttribute.description: The size of the file

writesAttribute.name: box.timestamp
writesAttribute.description: The last modified time of the file

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.FetchBoxFileInfo
extension.description: Fetches metadata for files from Box and adds it to the FlowFile's attributes.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: File ID
property.description: The ID of the File to fetch metadata for

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile will be routed here if fetching the file metadata fails.

relationship.name: not.found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box file was not found.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile will be routed here after successfully fetching the file metadata.

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The id of the file

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the file

writesAttribute.name: path
writesAttribute.description: The folder path where the file is located

writesAttribute.name: box.path.folder.ids
writesAttribute.description: A comma separated list of file path_collection IDs

writesAttribute.name: box.size
writesAttribute.description: The size of the file

writesAttribute.name: box.timestamp
writesAttribute.description: The last modified time of the file

writesAttribute.name: box.created.at
writesAttribute.description: The creation date of the file

writesAttribute.name: box.owner
writesAttribute.description: The name of the file owner

writesAttribute.name: box.owner.id
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the file owner

writesAttribute.name: box.owner.login
writesAttribute.description: The login of the file owner

writesAttribute.name: box.description
writesAttribute.description: The description of the file

writesAttribute.name: box.etag
writesAttribute.description: The etag of the file

writesAttribute.name: box.sha1
writesAttribute.description: The SHA-1 hash of the file

writesAttribute.name: box.content.created.at
writesAttribute.description: The date the content was created

writesAttribute.name: box.content.modified.at
writesAttribute.description: The date the content was modified

writesAttribute.name: box.item.status
writesAttribute.description: The status of the file (active, trashed, etc.)

writesAttribute.name: box.sequence_id
writesAttribute.description: The sequence ID of the file

writesAttribute.name: box.parent.folder.id
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the parent folder

writesAttribute.name: box.trashed.at
writesAttribute.description: The date the file was trashed, if applicable

writesAttribute.name: box.purged.at
writesAttribute.description: The date the file was purged, if applicable

writesAttribute.name: box.shared.link
writesAttribute.description: The shared link of the file, if any

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.FetchBoxFileMetadataInstance
extension.description: Retrieves specific metadata instance associated with a Box file using template key and scope.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: File ID
property.description: The ID of the file for which to fetch metadata.

property.name: Template Key
property.description: The metadata template key to retrieve.

property.name: Template Scope
property.description: The metadata template scope (e.g., 'enterprise', 'global').

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile will be routed here if there is an error fetching metadata instance from the file.

relationship.name: file not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box file was not found will be routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile containing the metadata instance will be routed to this relationship upon successful processing.

relationship.name: template not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified metadata template was not found will be routed to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the file from which metadata was fetched

writesAttribute.name: box.metadata.template.key
writesAttribute.description: The metadata template key

writesAttribute.name: box.metadata.template.scope
writesAttribute.description: The metadata template scope

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The MIME Type of the FlowFile content

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.FetchBoxFileRepresentation
extension.description: Fetches a Box file representation using a representation hint and writes it to the FlowFile content.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: File ID
property.description: The ID of the Box file to retrieve.

property.name: Representation Type
property.description: The type of representation to fetch. Common values include 'pdf', 'text', 'jpg', 'png', etc.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles that encounter errors during processing will be routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: file.not.found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box file was not found.

relationship.name: representation.not.found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box file's requested representation was not found.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles that are successfully processed will be routed to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the Box file.

writesAttribute.name: box.file.name
writesAttribute.description: The name of the Box file.

writesAttribute.name: box.file.size
writesAttribute.description: The size of the Box file in bytes.

writesAttribute.name: box.file.created.time
writesAttribute.description: The timestamp when the file was created.

writesAttribute.name: box.file.modified.time
writesAttribute.description: The timestamp when the file was last modified.

writesAttribute.name: box.file.mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The MIME type of the file.

writesAttribute.name: box.file.representation.type
writesAttribute.description: The representation type that was fetched.

writesAttribute.name: box.error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box if the operation fails.

writesAttribute.name: box.error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box if the operation fails.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.GetBoxFileCollaborators
extension.description: Retrieves all collaborators on a Box file and adds the collaboration information to the FlowFile's attributes.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: File ID
property.description: The ID of the Box file to retrieve collaborators for

property.name: Roles
property.description: A comma-separated list of collaboration roles to retrieve. Available roles: editor, viewer, previewer, uploader, previewer uploader, viewer uploader, co-owner, owner. If not specified, no filtering by role will be applied.

property.name: Statuses
property.description: A comma-separated list of collaboration statuses to retrieve. Available statuses: accepted, pending, rejected. If not specified, no filtering by status will be applied.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles that encounter errors during processing will be routed to this relationship

relationship.name: not.found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box file was not found

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed will be routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The id of the file

writesAttribute.name: box.collaborations.<status>.users.ids
writesAttribute.description: Comma-separated list of user collaborator IDs by status

writesAttribute.name: box.collaborations.<status>.groups.ids
writesAttribute.description: Comma-separated list of group collaborator IDs by status

writesAttribute.name: box.collaborations.<status>.users.emails
writesAttribute.description: Comma-separated list of user collaborator emails by status

writesAttribute.name: box.collaborations.<status>.groups.emails
writesAttribute.description: Comma-separated list of group collaborator emails by status

writesAttribute.name: box.collaborations.<status>.<role>.users.ids
writesAttribute.description: Comma-separated list of user collaborator IDs by status and role. Only present when both Roles and Statuses properties are set.

writesAttribute.name: box.collaborations.<status>.<role>.users.logins
writesAttribute.description: Comma-separated list of user collaborator logins by status and role. Only present when both Roles and Statuses properties are set.

writesAttribute.name: box.collaborations.<status>.<role>.groups.ids
writesAttribute.description: Comma-separated list of group collaborator IDs by status and role. Only present when both Roles and Statuses properties are set.

writesAttribute.name: box.collaborations.<status>.<role>.groups.emails
writesAttribute.description: Comma-separated list of group collaborator emails by status and role. Only present when both Roles and Statuses properties are set.

writesAttribute.name: box.collaborations.count
writesAttribute.description: Total number of collaborations on the file

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.GetBoxGroupMembers
extension.description: Retrieves members for a Box Group and writes their details in FlowFile attributes.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: Group ID
property.description: The ID of the Group to retrieve members for

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: The FlowFile will be routed here when Group memberships retrieval was attempted but failed.

relationship.name: not.found
relationship.description: The FlowFile will be routed here when the Group was not found.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: The FlowFile will be routed here after successfully retrieving Group members.

readsAttribute.name: box.group.id
readsAttribute.description: The ID of the Group to retrieve members for.

writesAttribute.name: box.group.user.ids
writesAttribute.description: A comma-separated list of user IDs in the group.

writesAttribute.name: box.group.user.logins
writesAttribute.description: A comma-separated list of user Logins (emails) in the group.

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: An http error code returned by Box.

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: An error message returned by Box.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.ListBoxFile
extension.description: Lists files in a Box folder. Each listed file may result in one FlowFile, the metadata being written as FlowFile attributes. Or - in case the 'Record Writer' property is set - the entire result is written as records to a single FlowFile. This Processor is designed to run on Primary Node only in a cluster. If the primary node changes, the new Primary Node will pick up where the previous node left off without duplicating all of the data.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: box-folder-id
property.description: The ID of the folder from which to pull list of files.

property.name: recursive-search
property.description: When 'true', will include list of files from sub-folders. Otherwise, will return only files that are within the folder defined by the 'Folder ID' property.

property.name: min-age
property.description: The minimum age a file must be in order to be considered; any files younger than this will be ignored.

property.name: listing-strategy
property.description: Specify how to determine new/updated entities. See each strategy descriptions for detail.

allowableValue.description: This strategy tracks the latest timestamp of listed entity to determine new/updated entities. Since it only tracks few timestamps, it can manage listing state efficiently. However, any newly added, or updated entity having timestamp older than the tracked latest timestamp can not be picked by this strategy. For example, such situation can happen in a file system if a file with old timestamp is copied or moved into the target directory without its last modified timestamp being updated. Also may miss files when multiple subdirectories are being written at the same time while listing is running.

This strategy tracks information of all the listed entities within the latest 'Entity Tracking Time Window' to determine new/updated entities. This strategy can pick entities having old timestamp that can be missed with 'Tracking Timestamps'. Works even when multiple subdirectories are being written at the same time while listing is running. However additional DistributedMapCache controller service is required and more JVM heap memory is used. See the description of 'Entity Tracking Time Window' property for further details on how it works.

This strategy uses a sliding time window. The window starts where the previous window ended and ends with the 'current time'. One cycle will list files with modification time falling within the time window. Works even when multiple subdirectories are being written at the same time while listing is running. IMPORTANT: This strategy works properly only if the time on both the system hosting NiFi and the one hosting the files are accurate.

This strategy lists an entity without any tracking. The same entity will be listed each time on executing this processor. It is recommended to change the default run schedule value. Any property that related to the persisting state will be disregarded.

property.name: et-state-cache
property.description: Listed entities are stored in the specified cache storage so that this processor can resume listing across NiFi restart or in case of primary node change. 'Tracking Entities' strategy require tracking information of all listed entities within the last 'Tracking Time Window'. To support large number of entities, the strategy uses DistributedMapCache instead of managed state. Cache key format is 'ListedEntities::{processorId}(::{nodeId})'. If it tracks per node listed entities, then the optional '::{nodeId}' part is added to manage state separately. E.g. cluster wide cache key = 'ListedEntities::8dda2321-0164-1000-50fa-3042fe7d6a7b', per node cache key = 'ListedEntities::8dda2321-0164-1000-50fa-3042fe7d6a7b::nifi-node3' The stored cache content is Gzipped JSON string. The cache key will be deleted when target listing configuration is changed. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

property.name: et-time-window
property.description: Specify how long this processor should track already-listed entities. 'Tracking Entities' strategy can pick any entity whose timestamp is inside the specified time window. For example, if set to '30 minutes', any entity having timestamp in recent 30 minutes will be the listing target when this processor runs. A listed entity is considered 'new/updated' and a FlowFile is emitted if one of following condition meets: 1. does not exist in the already-listed entities, 2. has newer timestamp than the cached entity, 3. has different size than the cached entity. If a cached entity's timestamp becomes older than specified time window, that entity will be removed from the cached already-listed entities. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

property.name: et-initial-listing-target
property.description: Specify how initial listing should be handled. Used by 'Tracking Entities' strategy.

allowableValue.description: Ignore entities having timestamp older than the specified 'Tracking Time Window' at the initial listing activity.
Regardless of entities timestamp, all existing entities will be listed at the initial listing activity.

property.name: record-writer
property.description: Specifies the Record Writer to use for creating the listing. If not specified, one FlowFile will be created for each entity that is listed. If the Record Writer is specified, all entities will be written to a single FlowFile instead of adding attributes to individual FlowFiles.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are received are routed to success

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The id of the file

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the file

writesAttribute.name: path
writesAttribute.description: The folder path where the file is located

writesAttribute.name: box.size
writesAttribute.description: The size of the file

writesAttribute.name: box.timestamp
writesAttribute.description: The last modified time of the file

stateful.description: The processor stores necessary data to be able to keep track what files have been listed already. What exactly needs to be stored depends on the 'Listing Strategy'.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.ListBoxFileInfo
extension.description: Fetches file metadata for each file in a Box Folder. Takes a flowFile with a folder ID attribute and outputs flowFiles with records containing all file metadata.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: Folder ID
property.description: The ID of the folder from which to fetch files.

property.name: Search Recursively
property.description: When 'true', will include files from sub-folders. Otherwise, will return only files that are within the folder defined by the 'Folder ID' property.

property.name: Minimum File Age
property.description: The minimum age a file must be in order to be considered; any files younger than this will be ignored.

property.name: Record Writer
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for writing the metadata records. Must be set.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile will be routed here if there is an error fetching file metadata from the folder.

relationship.name: not.found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box folder was not found will be routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile containing the file metadata records will be routed to this relationship upon successful processing.

writesAttribute.name: box.folder.id
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the folder from which files were fetched

writesAttribute.name: record.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of records in the FlowFile

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The MIME Type specified by the Record Writer

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.ListBoxFileMetadataInstances
extension.description: Retrieves all metadata instances associated with a Box file.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: File ID
property.description: The ID of the file for which to fetch metadata.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile will be routed here if there is an error fetching metadata instances from the file.

relationship.name: not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box file was not found will be routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile containing the metadata instances records will be routed to this relationship upon successful processing.

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the file from which metadata was fetched

writesAttribute.name: record.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of records in the FlowFile

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The MIME Type specified by the Record Writer

writesAttribute.name: box.metadata.instances.names
writesAttribute.description: Comma-separated list of instances names

writesAttribute.name: box.metadata.instances.count
writesAttribute.description: Number of metadata instances found

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.ListBoxFileMetadataTemplates
extension.description: Retrieves all metadata templates associated with a Box file.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: File ID
property.description: The ID of the file for which to fetch metadata.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile will be routed here if there is an error fetching metadata templates from the file.

relationship.name: not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box file was not found will be routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile containing the metadata template records will be routed to this relationship upon successful processing.

writesAttribute.name: box.file.id
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the file from which metadata was fetched

writesAttribute.name: record.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of records in the FlowFile

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The MIME Type specified by the Record Writer

writesAttribute.name: box.metadata.templates.names
writesAttribute.description: Comma-separated list of template names

writesAttribute.name: box.metadata.templates.count
writesAttribute.description: Number of metadata templates found

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.PutBoxFile
extension.description: Puts content to a Box folder.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: box-folder-id
property.description: The ID of the folder where the file is uploaded. Please see Additional Details to obtain Folder ID.

property.name: subfolder-name
property.description: The name (path) of the subfolder where files are uploaded. The subfolder name is relative to the folder specified by 'Folder ID'. Example: subFolder, subFolder1/subfolder2

property.name: create-folder
property.description: Specifies whether to check if the subfolder exists and to automatically create it if it does not. Permission to list folders is required.

property.name: file-name
property.description: The name of the file to upload to the specified Box folder.

property.name: conflict-resolution-strategy
property.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the specified Box folder.

allowableValue.description: Ignore conflict, do not change the original file.
Replace existing file in case of conflict.

property.name: chunked-upload-threshold
property.description: The maximum size of the content which is uploaded at once. FlowFiles larger than this threshold are uploaded in chunks. Chunked upload is allowed for files larger than 20 MB. It is recommended to use chunked upload for files exceeding 50 MB.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Files that could not be written to Box for some reason are transferred to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Files that have been successfully written to Box are transferred to this relationship.

readsAttribute.name: filename
readsAttribute.description: Uses the FlowFile's filename as the filename for the Box object.

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The id of the file

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the file

writesAttribute.name: path
writesAttribute.description: The folder path where the file is located

writesAttribute.name: box.size
writesAttribute.description: The size of the file

writesAttribute.name: box.timestamp
writesAttribute.description: The last modified time of the file

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.box.UpdateBoxFileMetadataInstance
extension.description: Updates metadata template values for a Box file using the record in the given flowFile. This record represents the desired end state of the template after the update. The processor will calculate the necessary changes (add/replace/remove) to transform the current metadata to the desired state. The input record should be a flat key-value object.

property.name: box-client-service
property.description: Controller Service used to obtain a Box API connection.

property.name: File ID
property.description: The ID of the file for which to update metadata.

property.name: Template Key
property.description: The key of the metadata template to update.

property.name: Record Reader
property.description: The Record Reader to use for parsing the incoming data

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if an error occurs during metadata update.

relationship.name: file not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified Box file was not found will be routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after metadata has been successfully updated.

relationship.name: template not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles for which the specified metadata template was not found will be routed to this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: box.id
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the file whose metadata was updated

writesAttribute.name: box.template.name
writesAttribute.description: The template name used for metadata update

writesAttribute.name: box.template.scope
writesAttribute.description: The template scope used for metadata update

writesAttribute.name: error.code
writesAttribute.description: The error code returned by Box

writesAttribute.name: error.message
writesAttribute.description: The error message returned by Box
